poem:
**Declaration**  

before dawn—  
shadows loom,  
steel birds  
ignite whispers;  
a rupture of quiet.   
    
dust settles  
on ambitions,  
bones of intent,  
silhouette of power—  
scattered.   

words drum  
through waking worlds,  
an echoing blaze—  
wars whisper,  
who lays claim  
to the first light?
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Netanyahu outplayed Trump on Iran. The surprise Israeli attack also killed some of Iran’s most senior military commanders and nuclear scientists. The Iranian regime called it a “declaration of war” – and western powers raced". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
